function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate monitoring of indoor air quality parameters","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Higher concentration of vocs in buildings can lead to skin, throat, and respiratory irritation, as well as broader set of illnesses including headaches, fatigue, and respiratory symptoms.","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Health risks associated with high co2 concentration in indoor air","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Routine exposure to non-liquid petroleum gas fuel linked to acute infections in the lower respiratory tract, including pneumonia and severe pneumonia.","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Excessive exposure to solid fuel increasing the number of deaths among children in the age group of 1 to 4","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Solid fuel reported as the most significant reason behind many cases of non-fatal pneumonia","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Indoor air pollution due to biomass and coal smoke","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Premature deaths due to the use of coal and solid biomass for cooking","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation leading to loss of productivity","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High temperatures due to lack of ventilation leading to loss of productivity","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conversion to open-plan offices may lead to a higher risk of contagious disease spread due to increased interaction and reduced physical barriers.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Different office plans may impact the spread of contagious diseases due to varying spatial layouts and density of people.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"High occupant density can contribute to the spread of respiratory diseases.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High indoor temperatures causing a decrement in productivity","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of communicable respiratory diseases through airborne aerosols","category":"Public health exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dismantling of partition walls may disrupt the containment of contagious diseases and facilitate their spread within the building.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Workspace design may not consider physical distancing measures, leading to a higher risk of disease transmission among employees.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Refurbishment plans and changes in indoor climate may impact ventilation and air quality, potentially affecting disease transmission rates within the building.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Health risks and reduced labor productivity due to social distancing measures","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased use of industrial robots may lead to higher risk of disease transmission
